blockchain.name: Random Game
blockchain.desc:
blockchain
Randomness is the main issue in this challenge, isn’t it?

crypto.name: ELWE
crypto.desc: My favorite cryptosystems are ElGamal and LWE, so I decided to combine them.

crypto.name: I will send it using only symbols.
crypto.desc:
The latest research on HAWK confirms that leaking the full vector x leads to a key recovery.

Weaker leak: you only get the signs. Still possible?

crypto.name: I will send it using only symbols. ex
Jerrys gift
crypto.desc:
Jerry has some gifts for you!

This is a revenge challenge of Amo's gift from Dreamhack CTF.

crypto.name: Rock Scissors Paper
crypto.desc:
You and Alice are playing rock–paper–scissors online.

Then they wonder how to trust each other.

They decide to use a hash function.

But it’s vulnerable to rainbow-table attacks.

Then they add a salt to the hash.

Finally, is it a fair game?

misc.name: baby dino
misc.desc: Why are you trying to implement a sandbox challenge? Deno already has its own sandbox.

misc.name: wram up
misc.desc: Welcome to CyKor CTF! Let's warm up a bit.

pwn.name: AKVC
pwn.desc:
boring theme, boring vuln, boring exploit...

can’t stop yawning 🥱

Note 1: If there are many connections, QEMU may slow down, potentially causing the exploit to fail. If it succeeds locally but fails remotely, please open a ticket.

Note 2: If you are using AppArmor, nsjail may not work properly. To disable AppArmor restrictions temporarily, run these commands:

sudo sysctl -w kernel.apparmor_restrict_unprivileged_unconfined=0
sudo sysctl -w kernel.apparmor_restrict_unprivileged_userns=0

pwn.name: Gram
pwn.desc: Man, this is bad. Why does the protocol have so much money? I need to theft it all! Contract looks safe... but...?

pwn.name: dbfs
pwn.desc:
the database in the filesystem!

Note: If you are using AppArmor, nsjail may not work properly. To disable AppArmor restrictions temporarily, run these commands:

sudo sysctl -w kernel.apparmor_restrict_unprivileged_unconfined=0
sudo sysctl -w kernel.apparmor_restrict_unprivileged_userns=0

pwn.name: shortcut
pwn.desc:
weird png filter

Please solve it quickly with a shortcut!

rev.name: ex cute
rev.desc:
A: "What a cute binary!"

B: "A cute binary? If you say so..."

rev.name: wrrm up
rev.desc: You know what? This is still just a warm-up, haha...

web.name: Safe embed
web.desc:
No script, no leak, absolutely safe

The final flag must match the regex CyKor\{[0-9a-f]{16}\}

web.name: asterisk
web.desc:
Just print * ! The flag format is CyKor{ }.

Please verify your exploit locally first before asking for an instance. 🙏 You can use the pow-solver.py file to obtain a container instance.

web.name: dbchat
web.desc:
I made a chatbot service. Try to leak the flag from the chatbot! The flag format is CyKor{ }.

Please verify your exploit locally first before asking for an instance. 🙏 You can use the pow-solver.py file to obtain a container instance.

web.name: flag checker
web.desc:
Check your answer and get on the leaderboard!

The final flag must match the regex CyKor\{[0-9a-f]{32}\}

web.name: se1enium
web.desc:
Fetch was the past. Selenium is the future!!

Please verify your exploit locally first before asking for an instance. 🙏 You can use the pow-solver.py file to obtain a container instance.
